overview.title: Past Perfect - Earlier Past
overview.subtitle: Actions before other past actions
overview.description: Use the Past Perfect to show that one past action happened before another past action.

affirmative.subject: I/You/We/They
affirmative.verb: had finished

affirmative.subject: He/She/It
affirmative.verb: had finished

affirmative.subject: Negative
affirmative.verb: had not (hadn't) eaten

affirmative.subject: Question
affirmative.verb: Had you seen it?

uses.label: Earlier past action
uses.example: When I arrived, they had already left.

uses.label: First action happened first
uses.example: I was tired because I had worked all night.

commonErrors.wrong: When I arrived, they already left.
commonErrors.correct: When I arrived, they had already left.
commonErrors.explanation: Use Past Perfect for the earlier action.

commonErrors.wrong: I had gone to the shop yesterday.
commonErrors.correct: I went to the shop yesterday.
commonErrors.explanation: Don't use Past Perfect alone - need two past actions.

examples.sentence: When we arrived at the cinema, the film had already started.
She told me she had never been to Japan before.

slides.title: WATCH OUT
slides.correct: When I arrived, they had left

overview.title: Past Perfect - Reported Speech
overview.subtitle: Report what someone said
overview.description: Use the Past Perfect in reported speech when the original statement was in Past Simple or Present Perfect.

form.title: FORM
form.pattern: She said (that) + subject + had + past participle

affirmative.subject: Direct
affirmative.verb: I visited Paris

affirmative.subject: Reported
affirmative.verb: She said she had visited Paris

affirmative.subject: Direct
affirmative.verb: I have seen it

affirmative.subject: Reported
affirmative.verb: He said he had seen it

uses.label: Report past statements
uses.example: He said he had finished the work.

uses.label: Past Simple â†’ Past Perfect
uses.example: "I went" â†’ She said she had gone

commonErrors.wrong: She said she went to Paris.
commonErrors.correct: She said she had gone to Paris.
commonErrors.explanation: Shift tense back in reported speech.

examples.sentence: He told me he had never eaten sushi before.
She said she had lost her keys.

overview.title: Past Perfect - Regrets & Wishes
overview.subtitle: Express regret about the past
overview.description: Use Past Perfect with 'wish', 'if only', and 'should have' to express regret about past actions.

form.title: FORM
form.pattern: I wish/If only + subject + had + past participle

affirmative.subject: Wish
affirmative.verb: I wish I had studied harder

affirmative.subject: If only
affirmative.verb: If only I had listened

affirmative.subject: Should have
affirmative.verb: I should have called

affirmative.subject: Regret
affirmative.verb: I regret that I hadn't prepared

uses.label: Express regret
uses.example: I wish I had studied harder.

uses.label: Talk about past mistakes
uses.example: I should have listened to you.

commonErrors.correct: I wish I had studied harder.
commonErrors.explanation: Use Past Perfect for past regrets.

examples.sentence: I wish I had taken that job offer.
If only I had known the truth earlier.

overview.title: Past Perfect - Completed Before
overview.subtitle: By the time / Before
overview.description: Use Past Perfect to show an action was completed before a specific past time or event.

form.title: FORM
form.pattern: By the time/Before + past action, had + past participle

affirmative.subject: By the time
affirmative.verb: By the time I arrived, they had left

affirmative.subject: Before
affirmative.verb: I had finished before dinner

affirmative.subject: By + time
affirmative.verb: By 9 PM, we had already eaten

uses.label: Completed by a time
uses.example: By 6 PM, I had finished everything.

uses.label: Done before another event
uses.example: I had eaten before you arrived.

examples.sentence: By the time we arrived, the movie had already started.
I had never traveled abroad before that trip.

overview.title: Past Perfect - Reasons/Results
overview.subtitle: Explain why (because)
overview.description: Use Past Perfect with 'because' to explain the reason for a past situation or feeling.

form.title: FORM
form.pattern: Past Simple + because + had + past participle

affirmative.subject: Pattern
affirmative.verb: I was tired because I had worked

affirmative.subject: Example 1
affirmative.verb: She was happy because she had passed

affirmative.subject: Example 2
affirmative.verb: He was angry because they had lied

uses.label: Explain reasons
uses.example: I was tired because I had worked all night.

uses.label: Show cause and effect
uses.example: She failed because she hadn't studied.

examples.sentence: I was confused because I hadn't read the instructions.
They were late because they had missed the bus.

overview.title: Past Perfect - Third Conditional
overview.subtitle: Impossible past situations
overview.description: Use Past Perfect in the 'if' clause to talk about unreal or impossible past situations and their imaginary results.

form.title: FORM
form.pattern: If + had + past participle, would/could have + past participle

affirmative.subject: Pattern
affirmative.verb: If I had known, I would have come

affirmative.subject: Example 1
affirmative.verb: If she had studied, she would have passed

affirmative.subject: Example 2
affirmative.verb: If we had left earlier, we wouldn't have been late

uses.label: Unreal past
uses.example: If I had known, I would have helped.

uses.label: Imaginary results
uses.example: If she had tried, she could have won.

commonErrors.wrong: If I would have known, I would have come.
commonErrors.correct: If I had known, I would have come.
commonErrors.explanation: Use Past Perfect in the 'if' clause, not 'would have'.

examples.sentence: If I had brought my umbrella, I wouldn't have gotten wet.
If they had saved more money, they could have bought the house.

slides.title: THIRD CONDITIONAL
slides.subtitle: Impossible past
slides.description: If I had... I would have...

slides.title: THE PATTERN
slides.formula: IF + had + VERB, would have + VERB
